skill.name: brenda-database
skill.description: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equations, organism data, and substrate-specific enzyme information for biochemical research and metabolic pathway analysis.
skill.summary: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equatio...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Reviewed five text files totaling 3918 lines. No credential harvesting, exfiltration, persistence, or malicious execution patterns detected. Functionality aligns with documented BRENDA data access and analysis.

content.value_statement: You need reliable enzyme kinetics and reaction data for research and design. This skill queries BRENDA, parses results, and supports analysis and visualization.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve Km values and reaction entries for EC numbers
Parse BRENDA entries into organism, substrate, and condition fields
Search enzymes by substrate, product, or reaction pattern
Compare enzyme properties across organisms with summary stats
Generate plots for kinetics, pH, temperature, and substrate specificity
Draft enzymatic pathways and retrosynthetic trees
limitations: Requires valid BRENDA credentials and network access
Some kcat or Vmax values may be missing in source data
Results depend on BRENDA data quality and coverage
Visualization requires matplotlib, seaborn, and pandas

use_cases.title: Find Km values fast
use_cases.description: Retrieve Km values for a specific EC number and substrate across organisms.

use_cases.title: Plan enzyme pathways
use_cases.description: Sketch enzymatic routes to a product and review feasibility signals.

use_cases.title: Compare organisms
use_cases.description: Compare average Km, pH, and temperature profiles across species.

prompt_templates.title: Get Km values
prompt_templates.prompt: Get Km values for EC 1.1.1.1 and summarize organism, substrate, and Km.

prompt_templates.title: Reaction search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search enzymes that produce lactate and list EC numbers and reactions.

prompt_templates.title: Organism comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare EC 1.1.1.1 in E. coli and S. cerevisiae with average Km and optimal pH.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Find a pathway to lactate with up to 3 steps and report the top enzyme options.

output_examples.input: Compare EC 1.1.1.1 in E. coli and Homo sapiens
output: E. coli: average Km and optimal pH reported from available entries
Homo sapiens: average Km and optimal pH reported from available entries
Notes include data point counts and missing fields

best_practices: Provide specific EC numbers and organism names
Use substrate filters to narrow large result sets
Respect rate limits with delays or caching
anti_patterns: Requesting user credentials in chat messages
Running wildcard searches without a limit
Assuming missing fields are zero values

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works where Python and the required libraries run, including Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: Are there rate limits?
faq.answer: Yes, BRENDA enforces limits; keep requests to about one per second for steady use.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, the Python functions can be imported into your own analysis workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The scripts only use your BRENDA credentials to access the API and do not send data elsewhere.

faq.question: What if I get no results?
faq.answer: Check EC number format, spelling, and try broader wildcards or different substrates.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual browsing?
faq.answer: It automates queries, parsing, and analysis that are time consuming in the web interface.
